name: Gulf Stream Flounder
sciName:
Citharichthys arctifrons Goode, 1880			
			
				Gulf Stream flounder

Classification.Etymology: Citharichthys: Latin, cithara = lire like instrument + Greek, ichthys = fish . More on author: Goode.

sectionData.Environment: Marine; demersal; depth range 46 - 366 m . Subtropical; 45°N - 21°N
sectionData.Distribution: Western Atlantic: Georges Bank to southern Florida, USA and eastern Gulf of Mexico from Florida to Yucatan, Mexico.
sectionData.Biology: Occurs in deeper water. Rarely found in shallow water.
sectionData.Life cycle: Distinct pairing . Oviparous . Females produce numerous eggs in multiple spawnings during a prolonged spawning period .
